name: make_ca
desc:
Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) is a method to validate the 
authenticity of an otherwise unknown entity across untrusted networks. 
PKI works by establishing a chain of trust, rather than trusting each 
individual host or entity explicitly. In order for a certificate 
presented by a remote entity to be trusted, that certificate must 
present a complete chain of certificates that can be validated using 
the root certificate of a Certificate Authority (CA) that is trusted 
by the local machine.
